column11: Description
column13: Notes

column11: No family
column12: no records
column13: no history... well
column14: if I didn't know better
column15: I'd think you were an orphan. But no records? With the Imperial orphanages
column16: even they have those nowadays. Perhaps you can sign yourself into one and go about arranging for the papers? It's amazing how much you can be denied by the Praesi without them.

column11: One of the conquered
column12: fate has not treated you kindly
column13: has it? Your homeland crushed beneath the heels of the invaders
column14: a country of Good
column15: bound to the whims of Evil? Sure
column16: there are some traitors who would say that the life of a peasant is better beneath the whips of the vile Praesi slavemasters
column17: but you know better. Your country cries out for revolution! To throw off the shackles of Praesi oppression! All you need is a Hero! Of course
column18: maybe you could claim such a Role yourself...

column11: A Legionnaire are you? And proud of it too! Surely
column12: you've joined up only after the Reforms. Though before them the legions would never risk fighting the Callowan cavalry with any numbers less than four for every knight
column13: in the modern day
column14: it's the cavalry that break when met on an equal field
column15: and the training that has brought the legions to that level will serve you well.

column11: Oh? So you call the Tower your home? Striving for the seat of Empress
column12: I suppose? Your knowledge of politics will serve you well in the days to come
column13: and your status as a native means that none will look down on you... for that at least. They're Praesi
column14: I'm sure they'll try to find another reason. Make sure not to give them one.

column11: You may pay 100 CP to change your starting location.%%%%%%The Tower: The heart of the Dread Empire of Praes
column12: the Tower is home to all sorts of insanity. The Dread Emperors were not the most stable of people
column13: you see. Fortunately
column14: you rarely need to make use of any but the 24'th floor
column15: where the Dread Empress holds her court.%%%%The War College: Where the Legions learn the arts of War
column16: few come unless it's to enlist. You are here to enlist
column17: aren't you? If not
column18: I suggest scurrying off
column19: Lord Black is not fond of spies.%%%%Laure: A city in Callow
column20: it's here that Lord Black will give a young orphan a knife
column21: and it's here that an Imperial governor is about to be executed. It's here that a Story is about to begin. Guide it or let it be
column22: the choice is yours.%%%%The Wall: Held for near 500 years before the Conquest
column24: it stands steady. As it's crewed by Imperials instead of Callowans
column25: it's location between the two countries means that there's quite a bit of travel moving through here.%%%%Procer: The Free Cities
column27: Procer is one of the remaining bastions of Good... even if it has an annoying tendency to fall into civil wars. Unfortunately
column28: it's spending much of its time holding the North against the Kingdom of the Dead
column29: which every so often takes a swipe at it.%%%%Kingdom of the Dead: ... This is... not the nicest of places to be if you're alive. As in
column30: it's filled with undead which will be all too happy to add you to their number. Might I suggest leaving? Soonish? I hear Procer is nice this time of year.%%%%The Lands Below: What
column32: are you doing in the lands of the dwarves? Why would you even want to be there? As far as they're concerned
column34: so if you don't leave right now
column35: you're probably going to get mugged.%%%%Free Choice: It appears destiny has favored you. Choose any location above.

column11: Destiny is a strange thing. Harsh and unbending
column12: but easily guided. A thing you have a talent for.%%%%You will find that you are capable of redirecting destiny as you must.%%%%Though a death curse may be lain upon you
column13: or a blessing upon your foe
column14: you can bend Fate
column15: redirecting the effects of the curse or blessing
column16: that perhaps your foes will be struck by your curse
column17: or your allies blessed by the luck that your opponent would have gained. Be careful
column18: however.%%%%Too strong a curse
column19: and you may find yourself struck by its collateral damage
column21: and you may find it difficult to direct them as you intend.

column1: Foundling - Hit Them With the Box?
column11: Powers are such odd things
column12: aren't they? Especially those granted by a Name.%%%%You
column13: however
column14: are good at cutting through their obtrusive nature
column15: and reducing them to their most fundamental nature
column16: then adapting that nature to better use.%%%%Whether using this to abuse your knowledge of warding to break the wards that make up the very walls of Creation and drop a meteor on your foe
column17: or just using your name to necromantically reanimate goats
column18: stuff them full of explosives
column19: and use the volatile reaction between your name and alchemy to create unusually large explosions
column20: you'll find that any powers you have
column21: you are absurdly good at abusing.

column1: Foundling - The Only Choice that Matters?
column11: It is the gift of the gods that all mortals are born free. However
column12: in the end
column13: every mortal is offered a Choice. To side with Good
column14: or to side with Evil. Some may falter when they see what they lose to that choice. You do not.%%%%The Choice of Good and Evil is not the choice of Necromancy or Healing to you
column15: and you will find that even as you have sunken into the depths of Evil
column16: you can draw upon the light of Good
column17: or that as Good bolsters you
column18: you can reach into the necromancy of Evil.%%%%Never will calling upon a power taint your will; you have made your Choice and nothing can change that.

column11: Roles. The sign of the gods within creation. Each granted a Name and three Aspects
column12: a Name is a mantle of power
column13: flowing from one potential bearer to the next
column14: and guiding them toward their Fate. A Role is born from belief
column15: from the ruts worn into creation when a story is told again and again
column16: and a Name is a place in the story that is told
column17: a sign that one has adopted their Role. Of course
column18: as in all things
column19: how something normally occurs is not how it must always occur.%%%%With this you find that you have the talent to form these Roles
column20: and bind to them a Name. By telling stories
column21: you can begin weaving the threads of destiny around someone
column22: forging a Name that will remain within the world you reside in.%%%%Although you may designate the first to bear it
column25: conditions for who shall gain it next
column26: thus designating the Role it will play
column27: a Name is bound to the world
column30: the Name shall flow onward with no more guidance than that woven into it when it was first forged.%%%%Forging a new Name and Role will take you six months
column31: three if you devote your entire attention to it.

column11: To be chosen by fate
column12: to be the hero of the tale... isn't it a wondrous thing? Choose a single weapon. Your skills with it are second to none
column13: allowing you to take on three opponents at once
column14: and emerge the victor... even before your Name steps in to boost your strength.%%%%With its might behind you
column15: you could walk through an army unscathed
column16: leaving nothing but corpses in your wake... assuming
column17: of course
column18: you had a combat-focused Name.

column11: You. You embody the reason Lord Black hates heroes. Fate will bend to accelerate your teaching. Somehow
column12: you learn far faster than you should
column13: learning in days what any reasonable person would require months to learn
column14: and when given a Great Evil to oppose
column15: learn even faster
column16: learning a year's worth in the same time.

column11: The Gods above have granted a powerful magic upon their chosen. Holy magic
column12: the magic of light
column13: healing
column14: and protection. This is the magic of Heroes.%%%%It's small scale
column15: better suited to strengthening the one who bears it than to massive acts of destruction
column16: but do not think the second is impossible for those who call upon it. This divine strength has other benefits
column17: however.%%%%You have been trained in these arts for five years
column18: and you will find your spells more difficult to disrupt
column19: even to the point that a Demon of Corruption cannot twist them away from you.

column1: Callowan - The Power of a Story
column11: Fate is a fickle thing. Do you truly wish to rely upon it? Very well
column12: so be it. The power of stories flows through you
column13: and you are able to invoke it upon the situations you come across
column14: even when you have left this world.%%%%You may twist the world to follow the tales you have woven
column15: the paths burned into Creation itself.%%%%For example
column16: if you challenge a foe twice
column17: the first time forcing him to flee
column18: and the second meeting him as an equal
column19: then you shall be guaranteed to survive until your third conflict. At that conflict
column22: no matter how fate must twist and bend to guarantee it. A last-moment burst of strength
column23: a spell learned in a day where others would take years
column25: he shall achieve it... within limits.%%%%You see
column27: it is the Choices that matter
column28: not the stories. If in the end
column31: then he will fall no matter what the story says
column32: delegated to a lesser role than he should have had. A further boon shall be granted upon you; that he shall only gain power in proportion with how much you call upon this power. If you are saved thrice from certain death
column33: then he shall match you. Four times
column34: and you shall be at the disadvantage. But if you do not call upon it even once
column35: then he will have no strength but that he gained himself.%%%%Of course
column36: this is not the only tale you can weave.%%%%Other tales can be woven just as well
column37: a sword stuck in a stone
column38: a crown found by a child... but whatever the tale
column39: Destiny shall force it across it's path
column40: and punish those who attempt to deviate from it.%%%%A final warning
column41: however. This is not absolute in either direction. Push a story too far
column42: and Fate may decide that the story simply isn't worth keeping around. Defeat your foe
column45: or push the tale too far
column46: and you may find yourself slain by a â€˜greater' threat for your recent rival.%%%%%%%%This lets you create a story trope
column47: and destiny will intervene to make sure it happens
column48: then punish anyone who acts against it. The weaknesses are these:%%%%First
column49: the story will backlash you when it ends.%%%%Second
column50: the destiny can be broken through sheer stubbornness.%%%%Third

column11: One Sin. Defeat. One Grace. Victory. These are the words that every member of the Legion lives by. You've been trained in the legions
column12: and are proficient with rank-to-rank fighting with the gladius and scutum
column13: the usage of goblin munitions
column14: and mass spellcasting (assuming
column15: of course
column16: that you're capable of spellcasting).%%%%Furthermore
column17: you know how to create goblin munitions
column18: including the magic-eating goblinfire.%%%%While this won't let you stand up to a Hero on it's own
column19: the discipline of a legionnaire and their skill against others on their level is not to be doubted. As one of the Named yourself? Well
column20: this level of skill can be quite effective
column21: though it's enhanced with the assistance of fellow warriors.

column11: An army
column12: like a snake
column13: moves on it's stomach. You're now capable of keeping even the largest of armies fed through pure logistics skill alone
column14: and are capable of planning supply lines and other such necessities for militaries with little issue.

column11: Unlike Praesi demon summoners
column12: or callowan light casters
column13: you're trained in the magic of the legions. Simple
column14: fast
column15: and easy
column16: your training is geared toward magic that you can simply throw at your foes. Sure
column17: you might not be as flexible as anyone else... but why do you care? While they're fumbling for which exact spell will deal with a situation
column18: you'll be able to throw out ten that are simply â€œgood enough."%%%%You've been drilled in these magics for five years
column19: and your spells are faster and more efficient.

column11: Do you know the worst part of being a Villain? Not knowing you're going to lose
column12: no. It's that the Heroes didn't deserve to win. If the heroes deserved their victories
column13: perhaps you could make peace with it. But they don't
column14: do they? That's always the way of it. At the last moment they're taught a secret spell by a dead man
column15: or your mortal weakness is revealed to them or they somehow manage to master a power in a day that would take a villain twenty years to learn. You loath it. And so you do not permit it.%%%%In any situation that your existence would be relevant
column16: the plot armor of your enemies simply fails as you force realism upon the world
column17: and force it to equalize. Morality
column18: last second burst of strength
column20: all of that means nothing to you. There will be no mysterious mentors teaching your foes your one weakness
column21: no absolute willpower that keeps them moving after you've killed them
column22: no training sessions that grant them years of growth in a day... no.%%%%They will meet you alone and armed only with what they have earned.

column11: You're a master of etiquette
column12: able to flatter someone you loathe
column13: and dance through the thousands of rituals that cover the Dread Empire without having someone drive a knife through your back.%%%%Further
column14: you'll find yourself able to learn new rules of etiquette within only moments of observation.%%%%Only be rude if you want to.

column11: If one were to compare the Tower that holds the nobles of Praes to a pit of vipers
column12: it would be the Tower that would come out looking worse. Vipers need a reason to bite
column13: after all
column14: while a Praesi noble will drive a dagger into your back
column15: kick you into a pit full of alligators
column16: and feed your soul to a demon just because she can. Fortunately
column17: you're quite used to dealing with them.%%%%Your skills at politics and spying are second to none
column18: letting you hold your own in a court that considers betrayal to be standard procedure.

column11: True
column13: Blood magic
column14: necromancy
column15: and demon summoning. What fun. The magics of Praes are dark ones
column16: appropriate to those in service to the Gods Below.%%%%Your knowledge of the ritual magic of Villains is amazing
column17: allowing you to bleed out a few prisoners in order to keep a massive area growing bountiful food
column18: letting you call powerful demons with little risk to yourself
column19: or forge powerful pacts with the greatest among them
column20: allowing you to singlehandedly turn the flow of entire battles.%%%%You have five years of training in these magics
column22: and can grow stronger still with sacrifices

column11: If there is one thing that every Praesi Emperor has in common
column12: it's the ability to take insane and ridiculous ideas and turn them into reality. Flying cathedrals that rain death upon their foes? Sentient tigers? Man eating tapirs? Giant cliffs to throw the hero down? WHY THE HELL NOT!%%%%You are capable of taking even the stupid and most insane engineering designs and throwing large amounts of magic at them until they work. Sure
column13: this might require sacrificing a few towns worth of peasants
column14: but that's the sort of thing that peasants are for.

column11: You may import a companion for 50 CP. They will receive a free Background and 600 CP to spend
column12: but will not be Named unless you pay an additional 50 CP per companion. If you do
column13: they will also gain the allowance of AP to purchase their Aspects. If you wish
column14: you may import all 8 for 200 or 400 CP respectively.

column11: If you wish
column12: you may attempt to convince a local to join you upon your journey.%%%%For 100 CP
column13: you may attempt to recruit any local who does not have a Name.%%%%For 200
column14: you may recruit a local who does have a Name.%%%%If the local agrees
column15: they will join you as a companion on your journey.

column11: A horse
column12: animated by what I assure you is the vilest necromancy. It will obey no orders but your own
column13: no matter what enchantments your foes attempt to weave around it.

column11: A tribe of goats
column12: slain
column13: emptied
column14: then stuffed full of goblin munitions before being reanimated as zombies
column15: I can't imagine what you'd do with these. Surely
column16: there's no practical purpose for a tribe of explosive undead goats
column17: right? You'll get another goat every morning.

column11: A book of children's stories of every culture
column12: containing both the tales and the various narrative structures which guide them.%%%%Further
column13: it lists the impacts these stories have had upon the cultures that tell them
column14: and contains summaries containing any and all similarities.%%%%Finally
column15: if you write even the barest hint of a story into the end of it
column16: it will give you a list of paths that story might take if it were to follow the narrative tropes of each culture. Though at first
column17: this may seem rather useless
column18: in a world driven by tales
column19: the use of such a thing is not to be underestimated.

column11: ... It’s sand. It’s literally just sand. That’s the deception. Weirdly though
column12: people will always fall for it
column13: especially if you shout “THE SANDS OF DECEPTION!” as you throw it into their faces.%%%%Perfect for distracting everyone while you run away.%%%%Comes in a nifty pouch the size of a mango when full. It refills every morning. Or you could just fill it manually
column14: if you’d like.%%%%The distraction effect will only occur if it’s filled with sand though.

column11: Okay
column12: so it’s technically not infinite. It can still hold enough alcohol to make a brewery’s yearly output do a double-take
column13: as well as a fleet of ships. As in you can literally shove a bunch of warships into the bag and carry them around. The bag will not increase in weight at all
column14: no matter what you put into it.

column11: A feather of an angel of contrition
column12: this blade will cut through nearly anything.%%%%Further
column13: if stabbed into a stone and used in a ritual you know which takes 49 hours
column14: it will call down an angel of contrition upon Creation
column15: who will then strike the minds of everyone within 49 miles with their every sin. No mortal in history without a Name has been able to experience this and not turn toward Good
column16: driven into a mad desire to make up for every Evil
column17: no matter how small
column18: that they have ever committed
column19: and forming the tip of the spear of a new Crusade.%%%%If you wish
column20: you may bind this feather to a weapon you already own
column21: adding these abilities to that weapon.

column11: Plate armor
column12: a gladis
column13: and a scutum. The arms and armor you’ve been given for joining the Legion
column14: goblin metal is high quality
column15: slightly better than common steel
column16: giving swords that few others can match.

column11: A set of goblin munitions
column12: enough for a standard match at the War College.%%%%Interestingly
column13: the bags that come with these munitions refill every night.%%%%You should probably avoid using these during formal matches
column14: but on the actual battlefield... well
column15: not having to requisition munitions can be quite helpful.

column11: An immense tower imbued with such heavy spellwork and defenses that even a fortress would grow jealous
column12: this serves as the perfect home for a mage. So perfect in fact
column13: that they’ve been outlawed simply due to how many mages have attempted to springboard their rebellions from them. You may choose where your Tower is placed at the start of each jump
column14: and may add this to another property you own
column15: if you wish.

column11: A set of fifteen non-lethal but highly embarrassing poisons and their antidotes
column12: perfect for throwing a party! After all
column13: anyone who can’t find out what poisons are going to be in use in advance clearly has no place being invited to one of your social gatherings.

column11: A beautiful dress (or suit)
column12: with impressive spellwork woven in. While none of the spells are defensive
column13: all of them will draw attention to your best features and away from your worst
column14: as well as enhancing your silver tongue. Even an ugly oaf would look halfway adequate in this. Of course
column15: the effects only grow stronger the more charismatic and beautiful you are without it’s help.

column11: A rather... understated name. This “egg” is actually a powerful artifact
column12: holding within it a Demon from the 13th layer of Hell. Anything that demon touches will be slowly corrupted
column13: twisted in both mind and flesh until there’s nothing left of the being it once was.

column11: Maximum of 600 CP
Creation is filled with roles
column12: with a way that things are inclined to go. You will find it difficult to fight these paths
column13: instead having yourself forced into specific roles
column14: such as a wise mentor
column15: or a hot-blooded hero. Unfortunately
column16: none of these will be a Role in and of themselves
column17: but you’ll still find yourself weakened when you act out-of-role anyway.

column11: Ah
column12: a Rival! Truly a well worn path! So well worn
column13: that someone seems to have been inserted into it for you! A random being in Creation will find themselves given the Role of Rival
column14: and will do their absolute best to show you up. Fortunately
column15: they’ll be on the same side as you
column16: so don’t worry about them killing you or actively fucking you over in a permanent way
column17: they’ll just... kinda be a dick as they try to be better than you.%%%%If you wish
column18: you can choose to take them as a companion when this Jump ends.

column11: You are extremely overdramatic. You just can’t help it! Whenever there’s an opportunity to chew the scenery
column12: you’ll be biting at it like a starving man. If you’re a Hero
column13: this will mostly be kind of annoying to your friends
column14: but oddly
column15: will tend to make you more effective during a fight. Therefor
column16: to Heroes and Ambiguous
column17: this is only worth 100. If you’re a villain
column18: this is liable to get you stabbed in the middle of your monologue
column19: or to preface you getting your ass kicked

column11: It seems you’re a favorite of the Dwarves. That’s a bad thing
column12: by the way. You see
column13: Dwarfish law holds that only Dwarves are capable of actually owning things. Everyone else just tends to have things in their vicinity. Which means that if a dwarf takes your stuff
column14: legally speaking
column15: he hasn’t actually done anything wrong. Add in that they can muster armies large enough to utterly annihilate any surface army
column16: and well.%%%%Long story short
column17: you’re going to get robbed a lot
column18: and reporting things to the authorities won’t help.

column11: Backstabbing. Always with the backstabbing. It’s like you can’t trust anyone these days! No matter what you do
column12: you will inevitably find that someone is doing their level best to betray you. It won’t be immediately dangerous
column13: but unless you simply don’t socialize at all
column14: expect your enemies to know exactly what you’re up to
column15: and for any weaknesses you have to be leaked. Even if you don’t talk to anyone
column16: expect to deal with scrying spells
column17: spies
column18: and other such methods of information gathering.

column1: The Girl Who Would Climb the Tower?
column11: It seems you’re an ambitious one. Your heart’s desire is to climb the Tower
column12: to claim the title of Dread Emperor or Empress of Praes. There are hundreds of ways in which this is a bad idea
column13: and most of them come down to “Because everyone else wants to as well.” The rest are
column14: of course
column15: “Because the Calamities will stab you in the face.”

column11: It seems that you’re an Orc. Well. Just about everyone looks down on you
column12: huh? The fact that your race tends to eat people’s eyes doesn’t really help. The fact that you’re the first Named to appear among them in centuries? And that their Names up until this point have been things like Warlord
column13: whose whole shtick was burning down villages and kidnapping the citizens to take as slaves? Let’s just say that Evil is generally racist against you
column14: and Good has good reasons to not be happy you’re here.

column11: Your Name is determined
column12: you are the Jumper. Unfortunately
column13: it appears this has brought... consequences. The Name only settles upon you the moment you enter the jump
column14: and the vast majority of your power slumbers
column15: locked away in your Aspects
column16: as of yet unknown to you (As in
column17: there’s a minor amnesia aspect so you’ll forget which Aspects you picked until you discover them during the jump). It will take immense amounts of time and effort to discover these Aspects and return access to the powers from beyond Creation
column18: and even then
column19: they will be limited in accessibility
column20: each only coming forth when the Aspect they’re bound to activates.%%%%If one of your Aspects is STRUGGLE
column22: you will not be able to call upon a third of your powers unless you find yourself struggling.

column11: For some reason
column12: no matter how many stories you hear
column13: you simply cannot grok the patterns behind them. Every single time the villain loses
column14: it will surprise you just as much as it did the first time.%%%%Normally
column15: this would just make you kind of gullible
column16: but in a world that literally runs on tropes
column17: this can be lethal.

column11: You have no Name
column12: and thus
column13: do not gain the benefits of the Named perk or supplement during this jump. Cannot take with Jumper.

column11: You
column12: among the many mortals in Creation
column13: have been granted a Role in the conflict that rules Creation.%%%%%%You are Named. Choose a side in the conflict that shatters the world.%%%%Hero?:%%The Hero
column14: are you? Your Role may be that of the Underdog
column15: but similarly
column16: is that of the one destined to be the victor. Good always wins
column17: after all. But do not rely on that too much. After all
column18: every victory is only so great as the failures before it
column19: and you may find that instead of the hero who freed the nation
column20: you are simply the man who was killed to inspire him.%%%%Villain?:%%So the Gods Below have your allegiance? Know this. You are destined to lose. The world’s a stage
column21: and you have been cast as the villain. Your fate is to fall
column22: at best shouting a dramatic line as you do... but as I said
column23: some have found ways to change the stories. Will you? It will be difficult
column24: you know. Destiny detests being prevented from taking actions
column25: and even if every potential hero is slain the moment he gains his power
column26: you will only find them rising ever more frequently.%%%%Ambiguous?:%%Oh? Is this truly the path you wish to walk? Though neither the Gods Above nor those Below recognize shades of Black and White
column28: simply by virtue of their Role
column30: pledging true allegiance to neither. Some transitional Names such as Squire
column32: can grow to become either the Black or White Knight
column35: are simply... less than fully concerned with the wars of men.%%%%%%The Named are powerful
column36: each masters of their field.%%%%Heroes find that Fate stands on their side. Despite often being teenagers shouting empty platitudes
column37: their increased learning abilities will have them learning a month’s worth of skills in a single night
column38: allowing them to force the world to kneel when it refuses to acknowledge the truth of their words. Although this only applies to skills that lie within the domain of their Role and Aspects
column39: it’s amazing how well such a boost can be leveraged. %%%%Villains
column41: will find themselves with greater abilities
column43: and will find their plans unfolding more easily
column44: though they’ll find their momentum runs out quickly. At the start of any task
column45: a villain will find his abilities heavily boosted
column46: though they will quickly return to more normal levels over time.%%%%Finally
column47: those with an Ambiguous name will find themselves drawing upon both sides
column48: though not to nearly the same extent as one who has truly given their allegiance. Their learning speed is increased
column49: allowing them two week’s worth of learning in a day
column50: and their abilities near the start are increased by half the boost of a Villain’s.%%%%%%Of course
column52: each of the Named share certain traits. A Named is enhanced across the fields
column53: increasing in their physical and magical abilities as is appropriate for that Name. Black Knight
column55: grants a greater physical increase than Warlock would
column56: but both will find their physical stats increased.%%%%The more specialized the Name
column57: the greater the increase in that particular area.%%%%Furthermore
column58: a Name will often (though not always) grant its bearer access to at least some magic if they are not already capable of it. The Black Knight and his Squire must be capable of Necromancy
column60: and thus the Name will grant them that capability if it must
column61: or enhance it if already there.%%%%%%Further
column62: each of the Named have 3 powerful Aspects
column63: representing a mixture of their Names and who they are underneath. Have 600 CP to distribute among 3 of the following.%%%%Finally
column64: you may choose a free title to take as your Name. Titles include things like Page
column69: if it sounds like it could be a TTRPG class
column70: it counts.%%%%%%A note: A Name will only grant the majority of it’s power when you’re acting according to either it’s theme or one of its Aspects. If your Name is Healer
column71: it’s not exactly going to help you as you run around murdering things. This also applies to the increased learning aspect of a Hero’s name.%%%%%%And with that
column72: one final warning: Heroes and Villains oppose one another. Such is the nature of their Names and Roles. A Hero who begins in territory ruled by Praes will find themselves almost immediately fighting for their lives; The Calamaties are well practiced at finding and slaying heroes before they can take advantage of their increased learning speeds and overthrow them
column73: and are also quite used to simply punching through the defense that Destiny lays around the Named.

column11: As a Jumper
column12: it’s only appropriate that you TRIUMPH over your foes. Your Name will do it’s best to assure your victory. So long as you can edge out even the slightest advantage
column13: your Name will take advantage of it
column14: granting you more and more power until you stand
column15: not simply the victor
column16: but in absolute TRIUMPH.%%%%Of course
column17: like with any other aspect
column18: there is only so much power your Name can feed you.

column11: Your name is a furious one
column12: it seems
column13: unwilling to be bound. This Aspect will turn your fury into RAGE
column14: allowing you to let your emotions spill forth and empower your blows.%%%%Be careful though; while a blade filled with rage will strike harder and it’s effects more difficult to heal
column15: it will similarly be less accurate as your emotions eat away at your training and skill.

column11: You run fast
column12: faster then most. In a dead sprint you could outrun a regular horse
column13: and beasts you ride are also much faster.%%%%However
column14: while it may make your feet light and your legs QUICK
column15: it does nothing for your hands or your eyes and thoughts.

column11: For most
column12: it would take years to master a mundane field of study. A SCHOLAR such as yourself
column13: however
column14: can learn such minor skills at an unusual pace.. As a note
column15: it greatly increases your reading speed.

column11: Some people are good. Others simply have the devil’s own LUCK. This aspect places you firmly in the second category. When casting a spell to hide you from a scrying spell
column12: you might miserably miscast it to the point where it will only hide you from a great and powerful sorcerer’s personal scrying spell but not his minions more common ones... on the very day that he orders his minions to stop wasting their time scrying for you because he’s about to start doing so himself.%%%%Unfortunately
column13: more than any other Aspect
column14: this one is vulnerable to being brute-forced.

column11: The skills of the Named are to be feared. So long as you fight with a blade in hand
column12: you will find that every SWING cuts through steel like butter
column13: and that your skills are unmatched among mortals.%%%%If you wish
column14: you may replace this with STRIKE
column15: PIERCE
column16: SHOOT
column17: or whatever is appropriate to a single weapon type of your choice.

column11: Can this really be called appropriate for a Jumper? Well
column12: so long as you find yourself in a STRUGGLE
column13: your Name will grant you power to meet your task.%%%%Unfortunately
column14: it won’t carry you all the way; a Name only has so much power to grant
column15: after all.

column11: Though all Named can call upon at least a degree of magic simply by throwing the power it grants them at Creation until something happens
column12: your Name is particularly tuned for magic.%%%%Somehow
column13: no matter how you fumble at it
column14: any spell you try to CAST will go off as you intended. Oddly common among the Bumbling type. Or perhaps not so odd
column15: considering that they’re still competent.

column11: For many Heroes
column12: one of their greatest strengths is themselves. For you however
column13: it is your ability to TAME animals. From small and humble mice
column14: to mighty lions
column15: animals listen to your command and follow your will.%%%%However
column16: mythical beasts are beyond your control.

column11: Not all Heroes fight on foot. Many RIDE atop the backs of a horse or other beast
column12: and now
column13: so do you. Fighting atop a beast is natural to you
column14: and your chosen mount is enhanced with you. Becoming more enduring
column15: faster
column16: and stronger than any mundane equivalent. Be careful however
column17: for a horseman is measured by his horse
column18: and without it he is devastated.

column11: An Aspect often found in transitional type names
column12: that is
column13: names which eventually evolve into greater ones (Squire turning into Black Knight
column14: for example). This aspect will increase your ability to LEARN by half again. Yes
column15: this will stack with your other learning abilities.

column11: For each student
column12: there is a master. While not all of your students may be named
column13: you will have the ability to MENTOR others
column14: greatly aiding them in developing skills similar to your own.

column11: An Aspect more common to heroes
column12: so long as the Name holds out
column13: the bearer will not fall. Your magical power can be spent to sustain your life.%%%%Unfortunately this only heals wounds that have yet to kill you; you won’t bleed out
column14: but if someone bashes your brains out and you haven’t taken precautions
column15: well
column16: that’s that. Unless that happens though
column17: you will RISE until you run out of magic.

column11: Not simply casting a spell
column12: but INVOKING it’s true nature
column13: you’ll find that your reserves of magical energy are unnaturally high
column14: letting you cast spells with little worry as to their cost.

column11: Your senses are beyond those of mere mortals
column12: and no aspect of Creation is hidden from you. The corruption caused by demons
column13: the displacement of the stars
column14: the flutter of a butterfly’s wings a hundred yards away... all of it
column15: you will NOTICE.

column11: Almost exclusive to Heroes
column12: as the Gods Below hold little truck with any sort of organized religions
column13: you have been granted a small aspect of the Holy power of the Gods Above.%%%%You may BLESS those who stand before you
column14: healing them of their ills
column15: and washing away near any wound
column16: as well as making them stronger
column17: faster
column18: luckier
column19: and more durable for the week to come.%%%%Further
column20: you are one of the few beings in Creation capable of truly slaying a Demon
column21: not simply sealing it as others must.

column11: It seems your nature as a being born from beyond Creation has affected your Name.%%%%Your touch is anathema
column12: warping the flesh and minds of those you touch
column13: until all that’s left is madness and horror.%%%%Your presence will be enough to slowly CORRUPT those before you
column14: and your touch both accelerates and nearly guarantees it.%%%%And not just men
column15: but the very Laws of creation itself will slowly twist
column16: weakening the borders between the realm that the Gods created and the endless and primordial void beyond.

column11: The endless infinities
column12: born from your nature... are you
column13: perhaps
column14: a demon? This Aspect is one of those who are lost
column15: their very existence VOID.%%%%No power will detect your coming; neither mortal senses nor magical scryings and wards
column16: nor even the Names of those who sense the world around them.%%%%If one wishes to find you
column17: they must seek you out by the clues you leave of your existence.

column11: Far more common among those Names inclined toward rulership
column12: this Aspect is one of leaders and liars. Of politicians
column13: one might say. When you SPEAK
column14: you do so with the authority of creation behind you. Those standing in your presence find themselves hardpressed to deny your authority
column15: with only the most stubborn being able to avoid almost instinctively acting in accordance with your will.%%%%While many Named receive a lesser version of this ability simply by virtue of their Role
column16: yours is vastly superior
column17: even affecting beings that other Named would not be able to
column18: and far more subtle as well
column19: going unnoticed except by the extremely observant or self-aware.

column11: Unfortunately common among Rogues
column12: Thieves
column13: and Rakes
column14: this is an aspect that one would think more tilted toward Evil than it is.%%%%You can not only reach past magical wards and pick locks with the best of them
column15: but also STEAL things that
column16: by all rights
column17: you should not be able to. Making off with an entire fleet of warships during a single night level off theft.

column11: Sometimes a magician finds that his own power is not enough. Sometimes he finds himself making contracts. Fortunately
column12: your Name is well suited to such things. When you SUMMON a being and bind it to yourself
column13: you will find it’s price goes unpaid.

column11: You are the closest thing to a tornado of blades there ever was. You swing fast and hard
column12: both hands with separate blades. You truly are as SWIFT and as dexterous as the wind
column13: in both action and reaction. At least in close quarters.

column11: Being a leader is difficult
column12: however for you
column13: it is not so. Those underneath you are better at their jobs
column14: the commoners beneath them are hard working and peaceful. The right to RULE is a great responsibility
column15: with immense power
column16: although the full power of your Name is invested in others
column17: rather than yourself.

column11: Often found in Villains
column12: this Aspect is a powerful one. Though it possesses little uniqueness
column13: that is
column14: perhaps
column15: a boon
column16: as all the power of the Name is steered toward simply enhancing you in every way it can.%%%%So long as you are on the offense
column17: so long as you are the one who wishes to CONQUER
column18: your Name shall grant you it’s strength.

column11: The Heroic counterpart to CONQUER
column12: it is only natural that for every attacker
column13: there be a defender. So long as you act in defense of others
column14: your Name will grant you it’s strength
column15: letting you stand tall and proud in order to PROTECT them.

column11: The dominion of Villains
column12: this is truly a Villainous Aspect. By slaying a foe
column13: you may call upon one aspect of their being and TAKE it for your own.%%%%It will last for no more than ten uses... but surely that will be enough?%%%%Of course
column14: any power stronger than the amount granted by a Name will burn away more quickly
column15: and the strongest will simply exceed your grasp.

column11: Common to Names such as Warlock or White Wizard
column12: this Aspect is truly potent. Beyond placing near every magic within your reach
column13: it will empower your magic to a staggering degree.%%%%You will be able to reroute the fate of armies
column14: to single-handedly determine entire battles.

column11: You
column12: are really
column13: really good at the act of killing. Your weapons care little for whether someone is immortal
column14: or mandated to live.%%%%When you SLAY something
column15: it stays dead. Your weapon finds weak points in enemy armor
column16: your spells ignore resistances and immunities enough to potentially kill your foes.
